Former BCCI president IS Bindra passes away at 84
description: Former BCCI president and veteran cricket administrator Inderjit Singh Bindra passed away at his New Delhi residence on Sunday at the age of 84. His health deteriorated suddenly after lunch, and he died around 6.30 pm. The last rites of Bindra, a key figure in Indian cricket administration, will be performed at the Lodhi crematorium on Monday.

This evolving destination aims to engage all ages.

His fearless counter-attack, including a rapid 53-run partnership with Ishan Kishan, set the tone for India's comfortable chase. This historic knock followed a mixed series start, showcasing Sharma's growing reputation as a formidable top-order batter.

title: Cruz says Navarro, Vance blocked India trade deal; mocks Trump tariffs in leaked audio

Those claims, which include rumors of a pregnancy and a payout, have not been confirmed by Tomlin or the Steelers.

The TMC accused the BJP of normalizing misogyny, citing Prime Minister Narendra Modi's past remarks and the act of handing a sword to another BJP leader during the event.

description: AI pioneer Yann LeCun criticizes Silicon Valley's obsession with Large Language Models, calling the industry "LLM-pilled." He argues this focus stifles innovation as tech giants poach engineers, preventing diverse research. LeCun believes true artificial intelligence requires predictive "world models," a key reason for his departure from Meta to pursue this vision.

title: India Inc cuts volume hiring: Companies go selective on STEM freshers - here's why
description: India Inc is significantly reducing fresh graduate hiring, particularly in STEM fields, as companies prioritise industry-ready talent. This shift sees a focus on smaller, skilled teams and job-ready individuals proficient in cloud platforms, data pipelines, and AI tools.

description: Iranian women are leading a powerful protest movement, fueled by decades of repression and a fight for basic rights. The slogan 'Woman, Life, Freedom' echoes across the nation, a testament to their courage in demanding bodily autonomy and dignity. Despite facing severe crackdowns and personal risks, their defiance, ignited by Mahsa Amini's death, continues to challenge the state's authority.

title: Odia singer Abhijit Majumdar passes away: Cause of death and other details
description: The world of Odia music dimmed on January 25, 2026, with the passing of the beloved singer and composer Abhijit Majumdar at AIIMS Bhubaneswar. Enduring a series of severe health crises, including a cardiac arrest that led to refractory septic shock, his legacy is cherished by many. Read on to know more.

He has a chance to achieve something the franchise has never done by winning a playoff game in Denver. With the Patriots unbeaten on the road this season, Maye leads a confident team into a hostile, high-altitude environment.

Mark Tully dies at 90: Born in Kolkata to British parents; how BBC journalist made India his home
description: Renowned journalist Sir Mark Tully, who spent decades reporting from India, has passed away in Delhi at 90. Born in Kolkata to British parents, Tully developed a deep connection with India, covering pivotal events like the Emergency and the assassinations of Indira and Rajiv Gandhi. His insightful books explored India's complexities, earning him prestigious awards and a lasting legacy.

Biometric requests are also up, extending evaluation times.

The ICC replaced Bangladesh with Scotland after the BCB's request to move matches to Sri Lanka was rejected, citing security concerns. The WCA highlighted broader trends of agreements not being honored and a lack of player consultation.

Taylor Swift’s Kelce Romance Sparks Fears Her Songwriting Is Slowing
description: Taylor Swift recently admitted she once feared happiness could weaken her songwriting as her romance with Travis Kelce deepened. She worried that joy might replace the emotional tension that fueled her lyrics. However, her latest album proved otherwise, showing she can create vibrant, story-driven music even during one of the happiest chapters of her life.

title: Leon Draisaitl opens up on family and NHL absence
description: Leon Draisaitl returned to the Edmonton Oilers after a short personal leave to attend to a family illness in Germany. The star center spoke on Saturday about how the experience taught him to see hockey from a different perspective. With Draisaitl back, Edmonton looks to find consistency heading into the Olympic break.

title: Macklin Celebrini’s becomes 12th NHL player with multiple 25-goal teen seasons
description: Macklin Celebrini’s season continues to keep getting better. At 19, he has reached another rare scoring mark, putting him among a small group of teenage players in NHL history. His growth from last season is clear, and he continues to play with confidence and consistency for the San Jose Sharks.

title: Yankees Expected to Shop Power Bats After $165M Blockbuster Signing
description: The Yankees are poised to spend big on a veteran bat, potentially impacting top prospects Jasson Dominguez and Spencer Jones.  With an outfield crowded by established stars, these young talents might be traded to contenders seeking high-upside talent. This move signals New York's win-now mentality, prioritizing immediate impact over long-term development.

title: Simone Biles vs Chloe Kim: Olympic Stardom, Endorsements, and Net Worth
description: Simone Biles and Chloe Kim both became famous Olympic champions at a young age, but Biles is much richer. Biles has a net worth of approximately $25 million, compared to Kim’s $10 million. This is because Biles stays in the public eye all year, signs bigger brand deals and gets extra attention through her NFL connection after marriage. Kim’s earnings are more tied to Olympic seasons, which limits her income compared to Biles.

title: Happy Republic Day 2026: Wishes to share with friends and colleagues
description: Republic Day, celebrated annually on January 26th, commemorates India's adoption of its Constitution in 1950, marking its transition to a republic. This day honors the nation's freedom, unity, and the fundamental rights and responsibilities enshrined in its Constitution. It's a time to reflect on the values that strengthen India and encourage responsible citizenship.

title: Why Microsoft is asking engineers to test Claude Code alongside GitHub Copilot
description: Microsoft is now having thousands of its software engineers test Anthropic's Claude Code alongside its own GitHub Copilot. This move signals growing confidence in AI coding tools, with even non-technical staff encouraged to experiment.  Nvidia's CEO also recently urged engineers to embrace AI coding assistants, highlighting a significant industry shift.

title: ‘Doesn’t pass the sniff test’: Netflix rejects Paramount’s offer for Warner Bros Discovery
description: Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters dismissed Paramount Skydance's $108 billion bid for Warner Bros. Discovery as unrealistic, citing its heavy reliance on debt. He contrasted it with Netflix's more stable $82.7 billion all-cash offer, which is gaining traction with shareholders.  The potential merger faces significant Hollywood and regulatory scrutiny.
